metadata.title: CVE-2021-20193 on Ubuntu 20.04 LTS (focal) - low
metadata.description:
A flaw was found in the src/list.c of tar 1.33 and earlier. This flawallows an attacker who can submit a crafted input file to tar to causeuncontrolled consumption of memory. The highest threat from thisvulnerability is to system availability.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2021-20193` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

tar - 1.30+dfsg-7ubuntu0.20.04.2
tar-scripts - 1.30+dfsg-7ubuntu0.20.04.2
No subscription required

criterions.comment: tar package in focal was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1.30+dfsg-7ubuntu0.20.04.2').
